clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacodynamic and Pharmacokinetic Study of PL-ASA
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Open-label, 2-way Crossover Pharmacodynamic and Pharmacokinetic Study of a Novel Pharmaceutical Lipid-aspirin Complex Formulation (PL-ASA) at an 81 mg Dose

brief_summary.textblock: A randomized, open-label, 2-way crossover pharmacodynamic and pharmacokinetic study of a novel pharmaceutical lipid-aspirin complex formulation (PL-ASA) at an 81 mg dose

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a randomized, open-label, 2-way crossover study to assess pharmacodyamic and pharmacokinetic profiles following treatment with PL-ASA and EC-ASA administered under fasting condition at a single dose of 81 mg among the volunteers aged 50 to 75 years.

primary_outcome.description: Incidence of aspirin responsiveness among study participants, measured by inhibition of serum thromboxane B2 and thromboxane B2 levels

secondary_outcome.description: Presence of serum acetylsalicylic acid and salicylic acid

other_outcome.description: Effects on platelet function by light transmittance aggregometry
Safety, as indicated by any adverse effects

arm_group.description: PL-ASA capsule 81 mg, then crossover to EC-ASA tablet 81 mg
EC-ASA tablet 81 mg, then crossover to PL-ASA capsule 81 mg

intervention.description: Pharmacologic profile of different aspirin formulations

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female non-smoking subjects between the ages of 50 to 75 years inclusive, without known medical conditions requiring treatment
- Consumes on average no more than 2 alcoholic drinks per day for 30 days prior to study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Abnormal baseline laboratory results
- Current prescribed use of aspirin, warfarin or other anticoagulants
- Use of other specific medications within 2 weeks of study start
- History of certain medical conditions
- Subject's platelets are unresponsive to arachidonic acid, as defined as <60% of aggregation as measured by light transmittance aggregometry
